text:
This time last year, the world watched a nervous Prince George tightly holding his father's hand as he made his way to his first day of school.

With a then-pregnant Kate Middleton at home due to extreme morning sickness, Prince William and his eldest son to school waved for the cameras as they entered the school gates before posing for the tot's official first day photograph.

This content is imported from {embed-name}. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.

On Thursday, the five-year-old will return to Thomas’s Academy in Battersea for his first day of Year 1, but photographers and journalists have not been invited to report of this week's historic event.

RICHARD POHLE Getty Images

Why?

Well, HELLO!'s royal correspondent Emily Nash explains: 'Prince George's time at school is private and although the Duke and Duchess shared an image from his first day at primary school last year, they won't do it every year.'

Royal tradition appears to dictate that children are pictured on their very first day of school, but aren't photographed in following years.

Handout Getty Images

This would explain why we've only seen a handful of portraits on George on his first at Westacre Montessori in January 2016, and of Princess Charlotte attending her first day at Willcocks Nursery School in Kensington earlier this year.

Come to think of it, there are only a couple of snaps of Prince William and Prince Harry on their first days of a new school.

Tim Graham Getty Images

The Express reports Prince George will return for the autumn school term on 6 September and will be expected to start ballet lessons this year.

Kate, Duchess of Cambridge is expected to drop off her son as she and husband Prince William regularly participate in the school run.

Meanwhile, Princess Charlotte will return to school on Wednesday 5 September, according to the nursery's term dates.

This content is imported from Twitter. You may be able to find the same content in another format, or you may be able to find more information, at their web site.

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are very pleased to share two photographs of Princess Charlotte at Kensington Palace this morning. pic.twitter.com/dDIOZdA7aM — The Prince and Princess of Wales (@KensingtonRoyal) January 8, 2018

The three-year-old celebrated her first day at nursery in January, with Kensington Palace releasing a set of images of the student dressed in a red duffel coat and pink scarf on the steps of the school.

George and Charlotte are expected to make their next public appearance on Friday 12 October, when they attend Princess Eugenie's wedding in Windsor.

It is yet to be confirmed whether the royals will act as a pageboy and bridesmaid, as they did for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's big day in May.
authors: Katie O Malley Is The Deputy Digital Editor
title: Why You Won't See Official Photos From Prince George And Princess Charlotte's First Day At School

og.title: Why You Won't See Official Photos From Prince George And Princess Charlotte's First Day At School
og.description: Royal tradition appears to dictate that children are pictured on their very first day of school. So why won't there be any this year?
